Curio ad focum: the story is abruptly introduced as evidence of Curius's continentia. — 11. auri pondus: the war was over, and the gift was brought by the Samnites, now his clients (quondam hostium, tum iam clien- stium suorum, dona repudiaverat, Rep. 3, 40fin.).—13. Poteratne: Cicero recognizes that the anecdote about Curius has been a digression. The present question and the fol- lowing sentence, Sed venio ad agricolas . . . ‚ recall the reader first to the general subject of old age, and then to the special ar- gument in regard to farming.
